intro: Pedicularis sudetica subsp. interior, commonly known as the Alpine beard vetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This subspecies is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. Its leaves are opposite and linear, and it is often found in association with other alpine flora in its specialized habitat.
